rooms.description: Spacious area featuring robust concrete finishes, emphasizing the Brutalist aesthetic with heavy use of exposed structural elements. Incorporates local materials and Vastu guidelines for energy flow by placing entry facing north-east.

Open-plan living space with industrial design elements. Large windows in a south-facing orientation to maximize natural light, aligning with Vastu principles of prosperity. Features exposed concrete walls, minimalistic furniture, and a large balcony overlooking the garden.

Integrated into the open-plan living area, offering ample space for dining. Reinforced by raw brickwork and concrete beams to match the Brutalist style. The location is designed with local building norms ensuring adequate ventilation and natural light.

Compact yet functional kitchen with industrial finishes and high-performance fixtures. Positioned on the west side to maintain balance in Vastu principles, incorporating energy-efficient systems compliant with local regulations.

Dedicated office space located near a large window for natural light; designed as a separate enclave within the open-plan living area using partition walls that still allow visual connectivity. Incorporates acoustic considerations and ergonomic design, in line with both Vastu and local building norms.
Small bathroom designed for guests. Utilizes efficient space planning and water-saving fixtures to comply with local standards while maintaining the Brutalist style.
